page.title: 04WILDLIFE - ROYAL BIRKDALE 2
page.content: Another nationally endangered creature the sand lizard is found here.In Britain this animal is confined almost entirely to the southern heathlands and to the dunes on the north-west coast of England.Both the natterjack toad and the sand lizard are given special protection under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981.The common lizard,common frog,common toad and sand newt are among the other reptiles and amphibians known to breed on Royal Birkdale.The course also provides a home for a number of mammals-the fox, rabbit,hedgehog,stoat,weasel and brown hare.Large numbers of insects,like beetles,dragonflies and leafhoppers, inhabit the dry grassy dune banks and the damp slacks.Some of these are local rarities.There are also rare moths and many kinds of butterflies.
